summary: The Clarity for Opioid-Use Reduction and Expenditures Act (CURE Act) aims to improve the administration, oversight, and impact of opioid use disorder grants. It amends the 21st Century Cures Act to establish a standardized system for collecting data from states receiving these grants. States will be required to submit quarterly reports detailing grant expenditures, recipients, individuals served, and other relevant information. The bill also modifies reporting requirements to Congress regarding grant activities and recipients.
